messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Bush On Schools (get out the airline barf bags!)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/5/2000 2:18:21 PM Central Daylight Time, ... This is pretty much what my libertarian husband says.  Politics is the art of compromise, and
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/5/2000 2:18:21 PM Central Daylight Time,
NumoAstro@... writes:

> What saints all these politicians are (LOL)... By rights we all out
> to be Libertarians as they are only party that believes in
> homeschooling/unschooling letting parents take care of their kids
> education without intervention from the goverment.
>
> Hope this hasn't started another flame war on politics because if it
> does I'm out this time... I'll just watch (LOL)
>
> Dawn F
> Tucson
>

This is pretty much what my libertarian husband says. Politics is the art of
compromise, and I don't believe that any politician is immune from illusions
of grandeur. In other words, I don't trust them. But, I'll look carefully
come November, and I'll vote. That way, I'll have the right to grumble in
January when he (whoever he is) takes over.

Carron

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Bush On Schools (get out the airline barf bags!)
messages.msgSnippet: NOW is the time to start getting a 3rd party really organized for the next election!  We need to let the other parties know that we want a choice and that we
messages.messageBody:
NOW is the time to start getting a 3rd party really organized for the next
election! We need to let the other parties know that we want a choice and
that we want them out there a visible before the big rush! It is the only
way to break the strangle hold the current money grubbers have on the
average citizen!

Lynda

----------
> From: Dawn Falbe <NumoAstro@...>
> To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
> Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Bush On Schools (get out the airline
barf bags!)
> Date: Tuesday, September 05, 2000 12:11 PM
>

> --- In Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com, Cararmst@a... wrote:
> > In a message dated 9/3/2000 6:23:14 PM Central Daylight Time,
> > lurine@s... writes:
> >
> > > Weelllll, IMHO, this is a prison sentence without a trial! Oh,
> and if you
> > > read the article, that evil, the NEA, that supposedly is only
> supporting
> > > Gore is out in full force behind Dubya and the KIPP idea!
> >
> > You know, I live in Texas and I've never heard of this KIPP thing.
> >
> > I do know that Bush is considered a proponent of homeschooling, and
> he has
> > never done anything in Texas to tamper with our liberal
> homeschooling laws.
> >
> > Carron
> What saints all these politicians are (LOL)... By rights we all out
> to be Libertarians as they are only party that believes in
> homeschooling/unschooling letting parents take care of their kids
> education without intervention from the goverment.
>
> Hope this hasn't started another flame war on politics because if it
> does I'm out this time... I'll just watch (LOL)
>
> Dawn F
> Tucson
